subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] if symbols that are 180 degree similar are confusing then shouldn't Quickscript/
msgSnippet: ... Perhaps: but _who_ is QuickScript/Read?  This group is the closest I ve come to an official body dedicated to the Read Alphabet, and I am not sure that
messageBody:
On 13 Aug 2004, at 08:46, satnordameriko asked:
> if symbols that are 180 degree similar are confusing then shouldn't
> Quickscript/Read create new symbols.

Perhaps: but _who_ is QuickScript/Read? This group is the closest I've
come to an official body dedicated to the Read Alphabet, and I am not
sure that there would be consensus on creating a modified Read
Alphabet. That might create a schism within the group, and I feel we
are probably stronger together than apart.

The problem, as I see it, lies only within the vowels. There are four
vowels (Et At Ox Utter) and four diphthongs (Eight I Oy Out) which are
respectively 90 degree rotations of each other. Ah/Am and Foot/Ooze
are either rotated or flipped from each other, making them also
confusing. However, while potentially confusing these characters _fit_
the language well! They allow for frequent connections between
letters, and are relatively simple while remaining distinct. I think
it would be difficult to create alternates which fulfill same
specifications.

oliver

The problem, as I see it, lies only within the vowels.  There are four

it would be difficult to create alternates which fulfill same
